page.title: 07POPULATION
page.content: The population today is 17 people. During the last 50 years it has not been above 40 people. The highest population recorded was in 1821 when 436 lived on the island. Hovever due to the clearances of people to make way for sheep this had fallen to 127 by 1861. The population has slowly declined ever since, although as can be seen from the age breakdown of the current population this trend might be reversed. (see chart on next page) The age distribution has changed greatly over the last 10 years as older members of the community have died or moved away. This has led to a reduced use of Gaelic Language on the island although more than 25% of the population can speak it fluently and more than 50% can understand some.
